item.title: complex numbers
item.description: Usually one think of the “Cartesian” form of complex numbers $s=a+i\omega$. Another wildly useful view is the polar form $e^{st}=e^{(a+iw)t}=e^{at}e^{iwt}$. $e^{at}$ control growth/decay, and $e^{iwt}$ controls oscillation/rotation.
